Some information is "born classified". Merely discussing certain matters in print (whether via hard copy or via email) results in the creation of classified information, just because of the nature of the conversation. A Secretary of State is unlikely (to the point of near impossibility) able to conduct her business (including emails) without engaging in conversations and information transfers that are highly classified by their nature, even as they are transmitted. Those working at this level of government know this. The fact that this sort of "born classified" information may have been (and almost certainly was) on Hillary's home server was a serious breach of national security matters, even without "markings".
